sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a trapezium.
message_1: A trapezium has a base of 10 cm, top side of 7 cm, and two non-parallel sides of 12 cm and 8 cm. What is the perimeter of the trapezium?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of the trapezium, we simply need to add up the lengths of all four sides.

Perimeter = base + top side + non-parallel side 1 + non-parallel side 2
Perimeter = 10 cm + 7 cm + 12 cm + 8 cm
Perimeter = 37 cm

The perimeter of the trapezium is 37 cm.
